title: Mexico's former top cop convicted of taking payoffs to shield cartels
description: Genaro Garcia Luna was found guilty by a federal jury of engaging in a continuing criminal enterprise that included six drug-related violations.

title: WATCH:  7-year-old channels Spike Lee in Black History Month tribute
description: This 7-year-old did her best impression of the iconic filmmaker for Black History Month.

title: Proud Boys saw surge in membership after Trump's debate message, ex-member testifies
description: A former Proud Boys leader, Jeremy Bertino, took the witness stand in Washington on Tuesday in the trial of Enrique Tarrio and four other associates

title: Vegas authorities investigating UNLV football player death
description: Authorities in Las Vegas are investigating the death of a 20-year-old UNLV football player after he was found unresponsive in bed in a studio apartment on Monday

title: Supreme Court wrestles with immunity for social media companies
description: For the first time, the U.S. Supreme Court wrestled with the scope of a landmark federal law that's given sweeping legal immunity to internet and social media companies.

title: West Virginia passes campus carry, bill heads to governor
description: A bill that would allow people with concealed carry permits to bring firearms on West Virginia public college and university campuses is heading to the desk of Republican Gov. Jim Justice

title: WATCH:  Baby elephants get 1st bubble bath
description: Baby elephant brothers really "tested the waters" for their first bubble bath.

title: Discarded cigarette butt, DNA tests solve 52-year-old murder
description: Officials say a discarded cigarette found near the body of a 24-year-old Vermont school teacher nearly 52 years ago helped lead investigators to an upstairs neighbor who they say strangled her in her apartment

title: Police: Woman, 44, killed in skydiving accident in Oklahoma
description: Police in Oklahoma say a 44-year-old woman was killed after crashing to the ground while skydiving

title: Brittney Griner re-signs with Phoenix Mercury
description: Brittney Griner is headed back to the Phoenix Mercury

title: 1st RSV vaccine could be approved by August, pending FDA review
description: The FDA will decide whether or not to approve an RSV vaccine designed to protect newborns by August 2023.

title: 4-day workweek trial: Shorter hours, happier employees
description: A trial of a four-day workweek in Britain, billed as the world’s largest, has found that most employees are less stressed, burned out and have better work-life balance

title: 'Senseless': New details emerge in killing of Temple University police officer
description: An 18-year-old "tussled" with Temple police officer Christopher Fitzgerald before the teenager allegedly gunned down the officer and fled in a stolen car.

title: Biden speaks in Poland after surprise trip to Ukraine: 'Kyiv stands strong'
description: President Joe Biden addressed the world on Tuesday from Warsaw, Poland, just days ahead of the one-year mark of Russia's violent invasion of Ukraine.

title: Mormon Church pays $5M to settle accusations it covered up $32B portfolio
description: The Mormon Church agreed Tuesday to pay $5 million to settle charges involving disclosure failures and misstated regulatory filings.

title: Bar employees stabbed inspectors at Mexico resort
description: Ten employees of a bar in Mexico's Caribbean resort of Playa del Carmen are accused of stabbing to death four municipal inspectors

title: Ukraine's health care on the brink after hundreds of attacks
description: Researchers have documented more than 700 attacks against health care facilities and staff a year into Russia’s war in Ukraine

title: California beach city weighs balloon ban to protect coast
description: The scenic seaside city of Laguna Beach, California, is weighing a plan to ban the sale and public use of balloons

title: Japanese startup unveils balloon flight space viewing tours
description: A Japanese startup is planning to launch commercial space viewing balloon flights that it hopes will bring an otherwise astronomically expensive experience down to Earth

title: Rights group: Mideast governments target LGBTQ people online
description: A rights group says in a new report that security agencies and government officials across several countries in the Middle East and North Africa have been using social media platforms and mobile dating apps to crack down on LGBTQ people

title: Philippines: Missing plane with 4 aboard crashed on volcano
description: The wreckage of a small plane carrying two Filipino pilots and two Australian passengers has been identified on one of the Philippines' most active volcanoes

title: Fears, questions about N. Korea's growing nuclear arsenal
description: North Korea’s recent resumption of missile tests highlights underscores its resolve to win the international recognition of a legitimate nuclear state and win outside concessions

title: Death toll rises to 8 from new Turkey-Syria earthquake
description: Authorities and media in Turkey and Syria say the death toll has risen to eight in a new and powerful earthquake that struck two weeks after a devastating temblor killed nearly 45,000 people

title: Buttigieg calls on rail industry to improve safety
description: Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg announced a three-part push to hold the freight rail industry accountable in the wake of the East Palestine, Ohio, incident.

title: Plant-based baby formula recalled over potential health risk
description: Reckitt said it would recall two batches of plant-based infant formula they produce due to "a possibility of cross-contamination with Cronobacter sakazakii."

title: Family of American terror victim asks Supreme Court to curb immunity for social media
description: The family of an American college student killed in the Paris terror attacks is asking the US Supreme Court to roll back legal immunity for social media companies.

title: Multiple people injured in explosion at Ohio manufacturing plant: Officials
description: Multiple people were injured on Monday after an explosion at a manufacturing plant in Ohio caused fires, law enforcement officials told ABC News.
